item.title: The Untold Story of Silk Road, Part 1
item.description:
The Untold Story of Silk Road, Part 1

How a 29-year-old idealist built a global drug bazaar and became a murderous kingpin.

item.title: Karl Ove Knausgård: In America, an Alcoholic-In Scandinavia, Just a Genius
item.description:
Karl Ove Knausgård: In America, an Alcoholic-In Scandinavia, Just a Genius

Karl Ove Knausgård, a Norwegian now domiciled with his wife and four kids in Sweden, is perhaps the world's most revered living writer. Only, if he were American, the principal thing he and everyone else would say about him is that he is an alcoholic.

item.title: Longtime marijuana use might make you a loser
item.description:
Longtime marijuana use might make you a loser

There's a new report out on longtime marijuana use. And it's bad news for habitual stoners. In summary: The more pot you smoke, the more apt you are to be a loser. And it's not so much that losers toke weed. It's that toking a lot of weed over several years turns someone into a loser.

item.title: How the Myth of the "Addicted" Baby Hurts Newborns and Moms
item.description:
How the Myth of the "Addicted" Baby Hurts Newborns and Moms

March 24th, 2016 Thirty-five-year-old Barbara Galarza found out about her pregnancy seven-and-a-half months into it, when she attempted to check into a detox facility in New Jersey in 2003. A urine screen showed she was pregnant, forcing Barbara out the door. That facility, like most other drug tre

item.description:
USA - New Study: Long-Time Marijuana Use Makes People More Likely to Become "Losers" - Drugs Forum

There's a new report out on longtime marijuana use. And it's bad news for habitual stoners. In summary: The more pot you smoke, the more apt you are to be a loser. And it's not so much that losers toke weed. It's that toking a lot of weed over several years turns someone into a loser.

item.title: The 'war on drugs' has failed and actually damages public health, major study finds
item.description:
The 'war on drugs' has failed and actually damages public health, major study finds

The five-decade long international "war on drugs" started by US president Richard Nixon has harmed the public health and should be scrapped in favour of a process of decriminalisation, a major new report has concluded. Anti-drug policies and laws have had "no measurable impact on supply or use" and cannot be justified on scientific or public health grounds, according to the authors of study commissioned by the Johns Hopkins Ivy League university and The Lancet.

item.title: Report: U.S. throws out almost $3 billion worth of cancer drugs each year
item.description:
Report: U.S. throws out almost $3 billion worth of cancer drugs each year

The U.S. medical system throws out around $2.8 billion worth of cancer drugs each year because they come in large vials that contain more medication than the typical patient needs, according to a new report from the Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in New York City.

item.title: Drugs: 396 Bay offenders get off with warning - Bay of Plenty Times - Bay of Plenty Times News
item.description:
Drugs: 396 Bay offenders get off with warning - Bay of Plenty Times - Bay of Plenty Times News

By Jordan Bond, Sonya Bateson Almost 40 per cent of drug offences in the Bay never get to the courts. Police statistics reveal 411 of the 1065 illicit drug offences in 2015 resulted in no court action, and 396 offenders received only a warning.

item.title: Poverty and neglect driving kids to drugs - Nation | The Star Online
item.description:
Poverty and neglect driving kids to drugs - Nation | The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: They were poor, their parents had divorced and the eldest son, a 16-year-old, found himself as head of a household which included his two younger siblings. Money was hard to come by. To make ends meet, the eldest got all three of them into the drug business.
